0.title: India's richest woman Savitri Jindal's fortune rose by $12 billion in two years: Forbes
0.article_body: India's richest woman Savitri Jindal witnessed her fortune rise by $12 billion in the last two years, according to Forbes. Jindal's net worth stood at $4.8 billion in 2020 and it has surged to $17.7 billion this year. The 72-year-old is the head of the OP Jindal Group, founded by her late husband Om Prakash Jindal in 1952.

1.title: 'Want to cast all my family in a film, call it nepotism', jokes Janhvi
1.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has said she hasn't been able to meet other family members due to their respective busy schedules. "The only way now to get the family together is to just do a film...like cast everyone in the family," she jokingly stated. "Maybe we'll have to call it nepotism only because it's all in the family," she added.

2.title: Getting 1800s train was impossible, created 400-foot train: Shamshera director
2.article_body: 'Shamshera' director Karan Malhotra said they created a 400-foot train for action sequence in the movie. "One...larger-than-life action sequence happens on a train. There were challenges because getting a train from the 1800s wasn't possible," he said, adding, "We were clear...that whatever we did, it had to look like it was from the era that the film was set in."

3.title: $18mn worth of elephant tusks, other animal parts seized in Malaysia
3.article_body: Malaysian authorities have seized nearly $18 million of wildlife contraband, their biggest seizure to date. The Customs Department said it discovered the contraband hidden behind sawn timber following checks on a ship on July 10. The shipment included 6,000 kg of elephant tusks, 100 kg of pangolin scales and 25 kg of rhino horns. The shipment reportedly arrived from Africa.

4.title: Before becoming Minister, Nityanand expressed desire to join RJD: Tejashwi
4.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav claimed that Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai had come with a request to be taken into RJD when he had not become a minister. Tejashwi said this after Rai criticised him for his "murti" remark against NDA Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu. Rai had "no moral courage" to react, Tejashwi said.

5.title: Rupee hits 80 per US dollar for the first time ever
5.article_body: The Indian rupee touched 80 per US dollar for the first time ever on Tuesday after opening at 79.99 per dollar. The rupee declined for the eighth consecutive session after crude oil surged on concerns about tighter supplies globally. At the time of writing, rupee was trading at 80.01 per dollar, after touching a fresh record low of 80.02.

6.title: Not going to be scared of anyone: Oppn's VP candidate Margaret Alva
6.article_body: Margaret Alva, the Opposition’s candidate for Vice President elections, on Monday said in politics, winning or losing is not the issue, fighting the battle is. "I will file the nomination tomorrow and will fight their (NDA's) campaign…I am not going to be scared of anyone," she added. Jagdeep Dhankhar, BJP-led NDA’s nominee for Vice President, filed nomination papers on Monday.

7.title: Not Tests, but future of ODIs looks uncertain: Ojha after Stokes' retirement
7.article_body: After England all-rounder Ben Stokes announced retirement from ODIs, ex-India cricketer Pragyan Ojha said, "We were worried about the Test cricket's future but the future of ODIs looks uncertain!" He added, "We may see many cricketers preferring to move away from this format." Stokes announced retirement stating that playing all three formats is "just unsustainable" for him.

8.title: I don't put limitations on myself: Sudeep on breaking language barrier
8.article_body: Actor Kiccha Sudeep said he doesn't put limitations on himself by sitting in a pre-conceived notion that he can do this and he can't do this. "If [the project] excites me, I just go ahead," he added. Sudeep stated, "I'd continue to do films for my directors...writers of my...state, also for all those...who write for me in other industries."

9.title: Hardik, Pant can form a pair like Yuvraj, MS Dhoni were: Gavaskar
9.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said Hardik Pandya and Rishabh Pant can "definitely" form a pair similar to Yuvraj Singh and MS Dhoni. "Both had the ability to hit huge sixes and...ran well between wickets," added Gavaskar. Hardik and Pant stitched a partnership of 133 runs off 115 balls in the third ODI against England which India won by five wickets.

10.title: Police arrests nephew for murder of former BBMP corporator's husband
10.article_body: Days after former BBMP corporator Nazima Khan's husband was stabbed to death in Bengaluru, the police arrested his nephew in the case. Mateen Khan, who allegedly killed his uncle on July 13, was arrested from Kengeri on July 17, said Deputy Commissioner of Police (West) Laxman B Nimbargi. Mateen had reportedly killed Ayub Khan over the presidentship of a mosque.

11.title: Pune Municipal Corporation invests ₹800 crore in govt securities
11.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has invested almost ₹800 crore in government securities till date, according to Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar. The civic body's Chief Accounts and Finance Officer Ulka Kalaskar said that this was done to get maximum returns as "fixed deposit interest rates [have] declined". The move is "completely safe" and supported by the Centre and RBI, she added.

12.title: My father was a big bully, he used to test his directors: Ranbir
12.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has said that his late actor-father Rishi Kapoor was a "big bully", adding that he used to "test his directors". "If he comes on too strong and...director doesn't hold his own and agrees to everything he says, he knows he has to take over the project," Ranbir added. "So he always did this testing thing," said Ranbir.

13.title: Delhi govt to train women as commercial drivers, to bear 50% cost
13.article_body: In a bid to recruit more women into the public transport network, Delhi government in collaboration with app-based aggregators will train about 1,000 women to become professional drivers. Women trained under this initiative would receive guaranteed jobs in these companies, the government said. Notably, 50% of the training cost for each woman (around  ₹4,800) will be borne by the government.

14.title: B'luru to get flyover linking Outer Ring Road & West of Chord Road
14.article_body: The foundation stone of a new flyover that will connect the Outer Ring Road and West of Chord Road towards Kurubarahalli Pipeline Road in Bengaluru was laid on Sunday. The half-kilometre flyover is expected to help decongest traffic. It will be constructed at a cost of ₹5.5 crore, said State's Urban Development Minister Byrathi Basavaraja.

15.title: BMC forcibly evicts residents from 7 'dangerous' buildings in Mumbai
15.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) forcibly evicted occupants from seven buildings located in Juhu-Vile Parle ward, which were declared unfit for habitation. The civic body had to take this step as the occupants refused to vacate the buildings even after their water and electricity supply were disconnected. Last month, a building in Kurla collapsed, leading to death of 19 residents.

16.title: B'luru commuters decry auto-rickshaw woes, say apps not reliable
16.article_body: Several people in Bengaluru have expressed concerns about the high auto-rickshaw fares in the city, saying the daily commute has become a major challenge for them. "The auto drivers in the city stopped using their fare meter long time ago," said a student. An IT employee said even app-based services like Ola and Uber are unreliable.

17.title: Bomb squad searches Mumbai area after hoax call from jobless, drunk cook
17.article_body: The bomb detection and disposal squad of the Mumbai Police searched the Mahalaxmi Race Course area of Mumbai after a cook, in drunk condition, informed the control room that bombs are going to be planted in the area. It was later found to be a hoax call. Reports said the cook had lost his job one day ago.

18.title: Rishi Sunak tops 3rd round of voting for new UK PM, only 4 remain in race
18.article_body: UK's ex-Finance Minister Rishi Sunak on Monday won the most votes in the third round of voting to succeed Boris Johnson as UK PM. Sunak received 115 votes, ahead of Trade Minister Penny Mordaunt (82 votes), Foreign Secretary Liz Truss (71 votes) and ex-Equalities Minister Kemi Badenoch (58 votes). These four candidates will enter fourth round of voting on Tuesday.

19.title: Will veto Sweden, Finland's NATO bids if promises not kept: Turkey
19.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on Monday warned that Turkey will veto the NATO membership bids of Sweden and Finland if they fail to keep their promises of extraditing individuals with alleged terror links. Erdogan said that he believes Sweden is "not showing a good image" for now. Sweden and Finland had agreed to consider Turkey's extradition requests last month.

20.title: Govt shares meme on fake post on 'liquor pipeline' connection at home, says 'chill guys'
20.article_body: Stating that a viral post claiming that people can apply for a "liquor pipeline" at their homes is fake, the government said, "Chill guys, Don't get your hopes too high." It also shared a picture of Nana Patekar from the movie 'Welcome', which has "control..." written in caption. The viral fake post demanded ₹11,000 from connection.

21.title: Pune records coolest maximum temperature in July since 2012
21.article_body: Amid heavy rains on most days in July, Pune recorded the highest day temperature at 30°C on July 3 and July 4, which is the coolest maximum temperature recorded in July since 2012. The all-time record for the warmest day in Pune in July was in 1966 when the highest maximum temperature reported was 36°C.

22.title: Mairaj Khan creates history, becomes 1st Indian to win men's skeet gold at ISSF World Cup
22.article_body: Indian shooter Mairaj Ahmed Khan on Monday created history by winning the country's first-ever ISSF World Cup gold medal in men's skeet. In the 40-shot final, the 46-year-old from Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh shot 37 to finish ahead of Korea's Minsu Kim (36) and Britain's Ben Llewellin (26).

23.title: Pant reacts to Yuvraj's '45-minute conversation made sense' tweet, says 'It did, indeed'
23.article_body: After former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh praised Rishabh Pant for scoring his maiden hundred and said that their 45-minute conversation made sense, the 24-year-old Team India wicketkeeper responded to Yuvraj's tweet. He wrote, "It did, indeed Yuvi pa." Pant scored 125*(113) to help India defeat England in the ODI series decider.

24.title: Russia's top-ranked female tennis player Daria Kasatkina comes out as gay, shares pics
24.article_body: Russia's top-ranked female tennis player Daria Kasatkina, in a recent interview, came out as gay. "Living in the closet is impossible. [It's] not for the long run...Living in peace with yourself is the only thing that matters...and f**k everyone else," she said. She later shared a picture of herself with her girlfriend Natalia Zabiiako, who's an Olympic medal-winning pair skater.

25.title: Twitter accuses Musk of 'slow-walking' trial, says 'it is harming us each day'
25.article_body: Twitter has accused the world's richest person Elon Musk of trying to "slow walk" the company's lawsuit against him for backing out of the $44-billion deal. "Millions of Twitter shares trade daily under a cloud of Musk-created doubt...This very public dispute harms Twitter with each passing day," Twitter said, urging the judge to hold a trial at earliest possible date.

26.title: 2 teachers booked for forcing girl students to remove uniforms near Delhi
26.article_body: At least two teachers of a government school were booked for allegedly forcing two Dalit girl students to remove their uniforms in Hapur near Delhi, police said. The teachers were taking photographs of students in school dress and two girls were allegedly asked to remove their uniforms and give them to two other girls who were not in school dress.

27.title: Live organs transported in 23 mins via green corridor in Hyderabad
27.article_body: Rachakonda and Hyderabad Traffic Police provided a green corridor for the transportation of live organs, heart and lungs, from Kamineni Hospitals in LB Nagar to Apollo 24x7 in Jubilee Hills, police said. The organs covered a distance of 21 km in 23 minutes during the transportation, police added. Rachakonda Police Commissioner commended the Rachakonda Traffic Police's service, police further said.

28.title: Dad Boney couldn't try acting as he was focused on brothers: Janhvi
28.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has revealed her father and producer Boney Kapoor could have tried acting if he didn't have the pressure of his father's business and his brothers' acting careers. "After work, he used to watch old music videos and act it out...I remember mom (Sridevi) would be like, 'I'm...glad...you didn't become an actor, you'll be so vain'," she added.

29.title: No force, 15 yrs of change happened in 2 yrs: Sudeep on South films in North
29.article_body: While talking about films from South working in North, actor Kiccha Sudeep said it "hasn't been forced". "It's high time we got theatrical releases...which we are now...It was bound to happen but what has happened in these two years is almost 15 years of change," he said, adding, "If I give you what you haven't seen...you will be interested."

30.title: 4 people shot at nightclub in Spain, suspected attacker stabbed
30.article_body: Four people were shot and one other was stabbed with a knife at a nightclub in the Spanish town of Marbella, police said on Monday. The person who was stabbed is suspected to be the one who opened fire, police added. Police informed that two of the four people who were shot and the suspect were in serious condition.

31.title: India and Fiji hold 5th Foreign Office Consultations in Suva
31.article_body: Delegations from India and Fiji held the fifth Foreign Office Consultations on Monday in Suva during which the entire gamut of bilateral relations between the countries was reviewed, the Indian High Commission in Suva said. The two sides also discussed ways to strengthen bilateral ties, the mission added. It further informed that the Indian delegation met senior Fijian cabinet ministers.

32.title: J&K LG announces 10% reservation for 'Agniveers' in police
32.article_body: J&K LG Manoj Sinha on Sunday announced a 10% reservation in the UT's police force for those who retire after serving in the military under the Agnipath scheme, PTI reported. Sinha said that his decision was influenced by the suggestion of two youths from Jammu. He further directed state officials to ensure that aspiring 'Agniveers' get the resources they need.

33.title: Terror hideout busted by security forces in J&K's Ramban district
33.article_body: Security forces busted a terror hideout and seized a cache of ammunition and explosives in J&K's Ramban district on Monday, officials informed. The hideout was detected during a joint search operation by the Rashtriya Rifles and the police, officials added. According to officials, a grenade, 35 AK rounds, explosive material and seven pistol rounds were among the items seized.

34.title: Goa reports 100% voter turnout in Presidential polls
34.article_body: All 40 eligible members of the Goa Legislative Assembly, including CM Pramod Sawant, voted in the Presidential elections on Monday. The polling started at 10 am and all 40 MLAs had voted by 1:50 pm, Secretary of the Goa Legislative Assembly Namrata Ulman said. She added that the polling was conducted smoothly and no complaints or objections were raised.

35.title: Yasin Malik to go on hunger strike if 'fair trial' demand not met
35.article_body: Kashmiri separatist leader Yasin Malik said that he will go on hunger strike from July 22 if his demands for a fair trial are not met, the Jammu and Kashmir Liberation Front (JKLF) stated. Malik moved an application to the Centre seeking personal appearance in two cases. He is currently serving a life sentence in a terror funding case.

36.title: Report claims Ronaldo to join Sporting CP as car seen at stadium, he calls it 'fake'
36.article_body: Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo has branded reports of a return to Sporting CP on loan as 'fake'. Reports had emerged from Portugal on Sunday claiming the Manchester United forward was at Sporting CP's Jose Alvalade Stadium to discuss a loan return to his boyhood club. A report had also included a picture of Ronaldo's car in the stadium.

37.title: Bajrang Dal activist attacked in Uttar Pradesh
37.article_body: A Bajrang Dal activist, Prashant Saini, was attacked in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur district by unidentified miscreants, the police said. Saini was on his way to pick up his son from school when he was attacked by five-six men, Additional Superintendent of Police Rajesh Kumar said. The activist was rushed to the hospital while an FIR was registered against the attackers.

38.title: Male model, friend arrested with cannabis worth ₹1cr; supplied drugs in DU campus
38.article_body: A 25-year-old Delhi-based model named Shubham Malhotra and his 27-year-old friend Kriti have been arrested with premium quality 'charas' (cannabis) worth ₹1 crore. The duo allegedly supplied drugs to youngsters around the Delhi University (DU) campus. They were allegedly procuring 'charas' from Himachal Pradesh's Malana and transporting it to Delhi hidden in a pillow in their car.

39.title: 2-time Olympic champion Crouser wins 1st shot put world gold in US sweep
39.article_body: Two-time Olympic gold medallist and world record holder Ryan Crouser won his first gold medal at World Athletics Championships in Oregon on Sunday as he led a US clean sweep with a championship record throw of 22.94 metres. Defending champion Joe Kovacs threw 22.89 metres to clinch silver, while Josh Awotunde won bronze with a personal best of 22.29 metres.

40.title: CBI arrests 8 persons for alleged malpractices in NEET UG 2022 exam
40.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) arrested eight people on Monday for alleged malpractices in NEET UG 2022 exam held on July 17. The CBI claimed that candidates' user IDs and passwords were collected by the accused, who made necessary modifications to get desired examination centres. The accused also tried to morph photographs to facilitate use of proxy candidates.

41.title: If I get 20 minutes with Virat Kohli, I might be able to help him: Sunil Gavaskar
41.article_body: Amid Virat Kohli's poor form, Sunil Gavaskar said, "If I had about 20 minutes with him...I'd...tell him the things he might've to do. It might help him." He added, "Having been an opening batter...having been troubled by [off-stump] line...there are certain things that you try and do. If I get 20 minutes...I might be able to tell him."

42.title: Zoho to hire 2,000 people as it looks to expand globally
42.article_body: Software-as-a-service (SaaS) startup Zoho is planning to hire 2,000 people across various roles in engineering, design, content and sales as it looks to expand its operations in India and globally. Speaking to Economic Times, Prashant Ganti, head of products, tax, accounting and payroll at Zoho, said that the company plans to grow organically and expand to other geographies.

43.title: iVOOMi Energy to set up Electric Vehicle manufacturing unit in Pune
43.article_body: iVOOMi Energy will set up an Electric Vehicle manufacturing unit in Pune with a ₹200 crore investment to enhance research and development. iVOOMi Energy aims to roll out more than 2,00,000 units by the end of FY23. The manufacturing plant will be operational from March 2023, and will provide employment to 2,000 people, the company said in a statement.

44.title: Nearly half of EU territory at drought risk as Europe braces heatwave
44.article_body: Nearly half of EU's territory is at risk of drought, the European Commission said on Monday as several parts of the continent are currently bracing heatwaves. EU researchers have also warned that lack of water and strong heat are driving crop yields lower in France, Romania, Spain, Portugal and Italy. Notably, Italy's longest river Po has significantly shrunk in size.

45.title: General Aeronautics commences commercial production of agri drones
45.article_body: Drone startup General Aeronautics has started the commercial production of agriculture drones with an aim to produce 100 units monthly. The startup had been conducting trials for the last three years, the results of which have been validated by 15 agricultural institutes, Srikanth Srinivasan, Head of Sales and Marketing, General Aeronautics said. The manufactured drone is named 'Krishak.'

46.title: BJP MP pledges salary to family of Udaipur tailor, gets death threat
46.article_body: BJP MP from Rajasthan Kirodi Lal Meena on Monday said that he has received a death threat via a letter for pledging his one month's salary to the family of Udaipur-based tailor Kanhaiya Lal. The letter says that whoever insults the Prophet or helps those insulting the Prophet will be killed, even if they are big leaders.

47.title: This Indian bowling unit is excellent: Siraj after ODI series win vs England
47.article_body: Speaking about India's bowling performance in the recently concluded three-match ODI series against England, pacer Mohammed Siraj stated that the current Indian bowling unit is excellent. "Like how Hardik Pandya came in and took the wickets of their well-set batters [in third ODI], that phase was really crucial for...team," he added. India bowled out England in all three ODIs.

48.title: UK residents asked to stay indoors as temp expected to breach 40°C
48.article_body: People in the UK are being advised to stay indoors and avoid non-essential travel as the country may experience temperatures above 40°C on Monday or Tuesday for the first time since records began. The advisory comes as the country has issued its first-ever red alert for extreme heat amid unprecedented temperatures. Notably, several regions in Europe are experiencing heatwaves.

49.title: Hardik Pandya shares video of his journey from injury rehab to India comeback
49.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya took to social media to share a video of his journey from injury rehab to Team India comeback. He wrote, "Through the ups and downs...with my people by my side. Woke up every morning raring to go...with the will to become fitter and play for my country. Always grateful to those who stood by me."

50.title: Rail Ministry shares before-after pics of Gauriganj Station, says 'Glimpse of new India'
50.article_body: The Ministry of Railways took to Twitter to share before-after pictures of Gauriganj Station, which is situated in Uttar Pradesh. "Glimpse of new India: Gauriganj Station," the ministry wrote alongside the tweet. "Superb," a user commented on the post. The station is located in Uttar Pradesh's Amethi district.

51.title: Veteran Bollywood singer Bhupinder Singh passes away at 82
51.article_body: Veteran Bollywood playback and ghazal singer Bhupinder Singh has passed away of a colon ailment at 82 in Mumbai. Singh is known for songs like 'Naam Gum Jayega', 'Kabhi Kisi Ko Mukammal Jahan Nahi Milta' and 'Hothon Pe Aisi Baat'. He's also been credited as a guitarist in famous Bollywood songs like 'Dum Maro Dum' and 'Mehbooba O Mehbooba'.

52.title: Precaution dose needed as protection is declining: COVID task force
52.article_body: National Task Force on COVID-19 head Dr VK Paul on Monday said the precaution dose of the vaccine is needed as the protection against the virus is declining. "We need to have optimal protection beyond six months of second dose. The precaution dose must be pushed in mission mode," he said. Paul added that there is fatigue in people's mind.

53.title: West can't isolate Russia & reverse its development by decades: Putin
53.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Monday that it's impossible for the West to isolate Russia from the rest of the world and reverse the country's development back by "decades". Putin added that Russia will have to develop its own domestic technology. Western countries, including the US and UK, imposed several financial sanctions on Russia following its invasion of Ukraine.

54.title: PM Modi-led govt's faulty policies reason for inflation: Kharge
54.article_body: Leader of Opposition in Rajya Sabha Mallikarjun Kharge alleged that PM Narendra Modi-led government's "faulty policies" are the reason behind the rising inflation in the country. Criticising the high food prices and retail inflation, Kharge said it showed "how little the Modi government cares for the poor". He further called the step to hike GST rates as "anti-poor and insensitive".

55.title: Stay alert: Uttarakhand CM to officials amid heavy rainfall alert
55.article_body: In view of the Indian Meteorological Department's (IMD) heavy rainfall forecast for Uttarakhand, CM Pushkar Singh Dhami has asked all District Magistrates to be on high alert. He also appealed to tourists and citizens to stay away from rivers and rivulets to avoid accidents. The IMD has issued a red alert in seven districts of the state for July 20.

56.title: 2 killed, 3 injured while making crude bombs in West Bengal's Murshidabad
56.article_body: Two men were killed and three others were injured in an explosion on Monday morning while they were making crude bombs in West Bengal's Murshidabad district. The deceased have been identified by the police. This comes within 48 hours of a similar incident reported in Malda district wherein three men died after the crude bombs they were making accidentally exploded.

57.title: Plane flips over & crash-lands at Somalia airport, passengers safe
57.article_body: A passenger plane carrying over 30 people crash-landed at an airport in Somalia's Mogadishu on Monday. No fatalities were reported and all those on board were rescued. The aircraft, which belongs to Jubba Airways, reportedly flipped upside down upon landing and burst into flames, which was doused by fire brigade officials. The cause of the crash, however, isn't known yet.

58.title: Scientists discover 1st dormant black hole outside Milky Way, share illustration
58.article_body: Scientists have discovered a dormant black hole outside the Milky Way galaxy. They have claimed that it is the first dormant stellar-mass black hole to have been detected outside of the Milky Way galaxy. The black hole that has been found is at least nine times the mass of the Sun and is 1,60,000 light years from Earth.

59.title: NEET aspirants allegedly made to remove burkha, hijab at exam centres
59.article_body: Two Muslim girls were allegedly made to remove their burkha and hijab at the examination centre to appear for the National Eligibility cum Entrance Test (NEET) in Maharashtra’s Washim, police said. The incident allegedly occurred at Matoshree Shantabai Gote College. As per the  complaint, the staff checking students made objectionable remarks including threatening to cut the burkha and hijab.

60.title: Negotiations with IMF for bailout nearing completion: SL acting Prez
60.article_body: Sri Lankan acting President Ranil Wickremesinghe said on Monday that negotiations with the International Monetary Fund (IMF) to secure a bailout package amid the country's ongoing economic crisis is nearing conclusion. He added that discussions for assistance with foreign countries were also progressing. July will be a difficult month in terms of securing fuel supply, Wickremesinghe further said.

61.title: Dosa sold as 'Naked Crepe' for ₹1,400 by US restaurant, Indian Twitter users react
61.article_body: A Twitter user posted a menu of an American restaurant which showed dosas being sold as 'Naked Crepe' and 'Smashed Potato Crepe' for around $18 (over ₹1,400). It also showed Medu Vada as 'Dunked Donut'. "Why can't they use the original names?" asked a Twitter user. "I've never been this pissed just by looking at a menu," said another.

62.title: When will fire safety regulations be implemented: Bombay HC to Maha govt
62.article_body: The Bombay High Court has asked the Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government to report the progress of implementing regulations for fire safety in buildings vulnerable to man-made disasters within a week. This comes after a PIL raised a grievance saying that regulations were formulated in 2009 in the aftermath of the 26/11 terror attacks but nothing was done to implement them.

63.title: Swedish fashion retailer H&M to exit Russia amid Ukraine war
63.article_body: Swedish fashion retailer H&M said that it will exit from Russia after pausing sales there in March after Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. "After careful consideration, we see it as impossible given the current situation to continue our business in Russia," Chief Executive Helena Helmersson said in a statement. H&M said the move will cost $200 million and affect 6,000 staff.

64.title: Italian PM visits Algeria for deal to replace Russian gas imports
64.article_body: Italian PM Mario Draghi reached Algiers on Monday to finalise agreements with Algeria that will allow the country to replace Russia as Italy's main gas supplier. An agreement to increase gas supply to Italy by 40% was reached between the two countries in April. This comes as Europe faces a possible stoppage of Russian gas supply over the Ukraine conflict.

65.title: Presidential polls witness 98.91% turnout at Parliament House
65.article_body: The polling for the 16th Presidential election was conducted on Monday commencing at 10 am and closing at 5 pm. As per the Rajya Sabha Secretariat, out of the 736 electors comprising 727 MPs and 9 Legislative Assembly members, 728 electors cast their votes which consists of 719 MPs and 9 MLAs. The total turnout was 98.91% at Parliament House.

66.title: 52nd India-Bangladesh DG-level border conference begins in Dhaka
66.article_body: Indian and Bangladeshi delegations led by chiefs of BSF and Border Guards Bangladesh respectively met in Dhaka on Monday to commence the 52nd Director General-level border conference between the two nations. Issue of cross-border crimes and future challenges will be discussed during the conference. It will conclude with the signing of a joint record of discussion, an official said.

67.title: Bernie Sanders slams Biden's meeting with Saudi crown prince
67.article_body: US Senator Bernie Sanders on Sunday criticised President Joe Biden's meeting with Saudi crown prince Mohammed bin Salman during his recent visit to Saudi Arabia. Sanders said he believes that a country whose leader ordered the killing of journalist Jamal Khashoggi should not be "rewarded with a visit by the President of the United States".

68.title: Govt advises screening of foreign arrivals as India sees 2 monkeypox cases
68.article_body: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare on Monday advised strict health screening of all international passengers on arrival to minimise the risk of importation of monkeypox infections. This comes after the country's second positive case of monkeypox was confirmed in Kerala's Kannur district. India's first confirmed monkeypox case was also reported in Kerala on July 14.

69.title: PM Modi to interact with Indian contingent bound for CWG on July 20
69.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will interact with 2022 Commonwealth Games-bound Indian contingent on July 20, Wednesday, via video conferencing, his office said on Monday. The interaction will be attended by both athletes as well as their coaches. CWG will be held in Birmingham from July 28 to August 8. A total of 215 athletes will be participating in the event.

70.title: Woman fired from her new higher-paying job after revealing salary on TikTok in US
70.article_body: An American woman said she was fired from her new higher-paying job after her employer discovered she disclosed her salary in a TikTok video. Lexi Larson said her salary increased from $70,000 to $90,000 when she switched from accounting to a tech role and posted about how she got the job. Her employer said her TikTok was a "safety concern".

71.title: Hardik was fluent in his innings, took pressure off Pant: Zaheer on 3rd ODI
71.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya for his batting in India's five-wicket win against England in third ODI, Zaheer Khan said the India all-rounder was fluent in his innings and took the pressure off Rishabh Pant by batting at a healthy strike rate. Hardik, who scored a 55-ball 71 at a strike rate of 129.09, stitched a 133-run fifth-wicket partnership with Pant(125*).

72.title: Who are David Beckham and Ronaldo Singh, who will represent India at CWG 2022?
72.article_body: David Beckham and Ronaldo Singh Laitonjam are among the athletes who'll represent India at upcoming CWG 2022. Both are professional cyclists. Beckham is 19 years old and hails from Andaman, while 19-year-old Ronaldo hails from Manipur. David got the name as his maternal uncle was a big fan of ex-England footballer David Beckham, while Ronaldo's name is inspired from Ronaldinho.

73.title: Woman kills 1-yr-old son after argument with husband in UP
73.article_body: A woman allegedly killed her one-year-old son after an argument with her husband in UP, police said on Monday. The accused, along with her husband and son, lived in Mumbai but had returned to UP earlier in July, police added. The woman killed her son after an argument over returning to Mumbai with her husband, the accused's husband alleged.

74.title: Wife of Afghan man who worked with British army denied entry to UK
74.article_body: The wife of an Afghan man who worked with the British army as an interpreter has been denied entry to the UK. The woman's husband, Hafizullah Husseinkhel, who fled to the UK from Afghanistan in 2014 after receiving death threats from the Taliban, said he feels "betrayed" by the decision. The woman is currently residing in a hotel in Pakistan.

75.title: Attempts of forces to harm India’s interests must be thwarted: PM
75.article_body: Attempts of forces to harm the country's interests must be thwarted effectively, PM Narendra Modi said on Monday while highlighting the need for a "whole-of-government approach" to combat myriad national security challenges. PM also spoke about the weapons the Indian Army will possess and said, "My jawans will have what the opponent won't even think of."

76.title: Shooting of Shanaya's 'Bedhadak' to commence next year: Karan Johar
76.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar took to Instagram to announce that the shooting for 'Bedhadak' featuring Shanaya Kapoor, Gurfateh Singh Pirzada and Lakshya is set to commence next year. This comes after reports surfaced stating that the film has been shelved. As per the makers' official statement, the actors are currently reading scripts and undergoing workshops for the upcoming film.

77.title: La Ganesan takes oath as Bengal Guv as Dhankhar nominated for Vice-Prez poll
77.article_body: Manipur Governor La Ganesan on Monday took oath as the new Governor of West Bengal after the resignation of Jagdeep Dhankhar, who has been nominated as NDA's Vice Presidential candidate. Ganesan has been given the additional charge of West Bengal. CM Mamata Banerjee welcomed him by presenting him with a flower bouquet after the swearing-in ceremony.

78.title: Uddhav fires Sena leaders for 'anti-party' acts, Maha CM adds them to his faction
78.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray on Monday sacked several Shiv Sena leaders, including former state minister Ramdas Kadam and senior party leader Anandrao Vithoba Adsul for anti-party activities. CM Eknath Shinde has reportedly appointed them as leaders of a new 'National Executive Committee'. Shinde also reportedly elected party MLA Deepak Kesarkar as chief spokesperson of the committee.

79.title: My jawans will have what the opponent won't even think of: PM
79.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Monday said, "It's not smart to let my soldiers go to the field with the same 10 weapons that the world has...My jawans will have what the opponent won't even think of." He was speaking at the naval summit in Delhi. PM Modi added 'aatmanirbharta' in defence is very crucial for the India of 21st century.

80.title: Didn't realise we were making memories: Juhi on 25 years of 'Yes Boss'
80.article_body: Actress Juhi Chawla shared a video montage of scenes from her film 'Yes Boss' on social media to celebrate 25 years since its release. She wrote alongside the video, "I didn't realise we were making memories...No words to thank the 'Yes Boss' team enough...for making such a lovely film watched by millions even today." The film co-stars Shah Rukh Khan.

81.title: Superstar in every format: ECB interim CEO on Stokes after his ODI retirement
81.article_body: After Ben Stokes announced his retirement from ODI cricket, England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) interim CEO Clare Connor said the England all-rounder is a superstar in every format. "His remarkable contribution to...World Cup final at Lord's in 2019 enabled England men to win that prestigious trophy for...first time," she added. Stokes will play his last ODI on Tuesday.

82.title: Nupur Sharma moves SC again, says 'got rape & death threats after SC criticism'
82.article_body: Suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma has moved the Supreme Court (SC) again to club the various FIRs filed against her over her remarks on Prophet Muhammad. She said she received "renewed" rape and death threats after SC's "unexpected and harsh criticism" of her earlier. The plea will be heard tomorrow by Justices Surya Kant and JB Pardiwala who'd criticised her.

83.title: Imran Khan seeks fresh general polls in Pak after Punjab bypoll win
83.article_body: Ex-Pakistan PM Imran Khan has sought fresh general elections in Pakistan after his party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) won 16 out of 20 seats in Punjab assembly bypolls. The results come as a setback for PM Shehbaz Sharif's son Hamza Shahbaz, who will now lose his designation as Punjab CM. Imran Khan was ousted as PM in April via no-trust vote.

84.title: India's defence imports have come down by 21%: PM at naval seminar
84.article_body: PM Narendra Modi while speaking at naval seminar on Monday said India's defence imports have come down by about 21% in the last four-five years. "We are developing new defence ecosystem in India," PM Modi added. He said, "In last eight years, we increased defence budget and also ensured it was useful in development of defence manufacturing ecosystem in India."

85.title: It was like rollercoaster of emotions: Sindhu after winning Singapore Open
85.article_body: Taking to Twitter after winning her first Singapore Open title, PV Sindhu wrote, "It was like a rollercoaster of emotions but managed to pull through and win the championship!" She added, "Always special to win in Singapore. Time for a much needed breather before the big one in Birmingham." It was world number seven Sindhu's third title of the year.

86.title: Kohli should leave excess baggage back in England, start afresh: Ojha
86.article_body: Pragyan Ojha said India batter Virat Kohli should leave the "excess baggage" back in England and start afresh. "He's going through a bad phase. What he can do is cut short...negativity," he added. Against England in rescheduled fifth Test, Kohli scored 11 and 20. While he managed 12 runs in two T20Is, he hit 16 and 17 in two ODIs.

87.title: Sequoia, Tiger Global led startup funding in India in Apr-Jun: Nasscom
87.article_body: Sequoia Capital and Tiger Global were the leading Venture Capital firms that invested in Indian startups between April-June in 2022, as per a report by industry body Nasscom. Both the companies invested majorly in the fintech and enterprise technology domain. Tiger Global and Sequoia Capital made 60% of investments in the growth stage of the startups.

88.title: Sanjay Nayar's maiden tech fund Sorin raises $100 mn
88.article_body: Sorin Investments, a tech fund co-founded by private equity veteran Sanjay Nayar and Hong Kong-based Caravel Group's Angad Banga has raised $100 million in its first close. Speaking to Mint, Nayar and Banga said that the fund will aim to raise $130 million. The funding saw participation from KKR Co-founder Henry Kravis and Hero Enterprise Chairman Sunil Kant Munjal.

89.title: Assam student arrested for supporting ULFA-I; 2nd arrest in 2 months
89.article_body: A 22-year-old college student has been arrested in Assam's Udalguri district for allegedly supporting the banned United Liberation Front of Asom-Independent (ULFA-I) online, officials said on Monday. The accused, Pramod Kalita, has been remanded to judicial custody. Kalita's arrest comes nearly two months after a 19-year-old girl was arrested in Uriamghat for posting "anti-national" poem online.

90.title: A farmer's son filed nomination today, grateful to PM Modi: Dhankhar
90.article_body: Shortly after filing his nomination, NDA's VP candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar said that a farmer's son filed his nomination and expressed his gratitude to PM Narendra Modi for giving him the opportunity. "Not even in my dreams did I think that a common man like me would be given such an opportunity," Dhankhar said.

91.title: Ola Electric to open Asia's largest battery innovation centre
91.article_body: Ola Electric will invest $500 million to set up Asia's largest battery innovation centre in Bengaluru, CEO Bhavish Aggarwal tweeted. The company's Research and Development facility will employ over 500 engineers and PhDs, and will be up and running by next month. The tweet, accompanied by a video, gives details and a virtual glimpse of the upcoming centre.

92.title: Man who killed minor girl in WB five years ago held in Mumbai
92.article_body: A man who escaped West Bengal after allegedly killing a minor girl five years ago was held from Mumbai's Malwani, a police official said on Monday. The accused had killed the 8-year-old girl in the Kaliganj area of WB and had been on the run since, the official added. He was arrested from a garment factory, the official further said.

93.title: Girls asked to remove bras at NEET exam centre in Kerala, complaint filed
93.article_body: Parents have alleged that their daughters were told to remove their innerwear before taking the medical entrance NEET 2022 at an exam centre in Kerala's Kollam on Sunday. The students were allegedly asked to remove bras because of their metal hooks and underwires. A parent filed a police complaint saying, "[My daughter] returned to us crying, distressed."

94.title: Virat Kohli reacts to Ben Stokes' ODI retirement, calls him 'Most competitive bloke'
94.article_body: Former Team India captain Virat Kohli reacted to England Test captain Ben Stokes announcing his retirement from ODI cricket. "You're the most competitive bloke I've ever played against. Respect," Kohli commented on Stokes' post on Instagram. Stokes said that he will play his last ODI on Tuesday against South Africa.

95.title: BJP leader Sultana Khan attacked by 2 bike-borne assailants in Mumbai
95.article_body: Two bike-borne assailants attacked BJP's minority wing (women) state president Sultana Khan in Mumbai on Sunday night. "Before leaving, the assailants said that this was just a token and that what you're doing is not right. Mend your ways else, we will finish you and your family," Khan's husband said. The accused attacked Khan with a sharp-edged weapon, he added.

96.title: Automobile thief arrested in Hyd, 8 motorcycles recovered
96.article_body: The Commissioner's Task Force, South Zone Team, Hyderabad, along with Asifnagar Police arrested an automobile thief and seized eight two-wheelers worth ₹5 lakh. The accused had a fascination for riding bikes, reports said. However, his earnings were not enough to fulfil his desires, so the accused started stealing motorcycles. The accused was released from jail in April 2022, reports said.

97.title: She's the last person to check bank balances, I was penniless: Sushmita's ex Vikram Bhatt
97.article_body: Talking about Sushmita Sen being called a 'gold digger' for dating Lalit Modi, her ex-boyfriend Vikram Bhatt said, "Sushmita is a love digger, not a gold digger." "Sushmita is the last person who checks...bank balances before she decides to fall in love with someone. I was penniless. I was directing Ghulam, but I had no money," he added.

98.title: 1 LDF, 2 Congress leaders temporarily put on IndiGo's no-fly list
98.article_body: IndiGo has put Kerala's ruling Left Democratic Front (LDF) convener EP Jayarajan and two Congress workers on its no-fly list for specific periods for their role in a scuffle on the aircraft that was also carrying CM Pinarayi Vijayan last month. Reacting to the ban, Jayarajan said, "It's a huge insult." He added that he will boycott the airline forever.

99.title: Pakistani rupee falls to all-time low of 212 against US dollar
99.article_body: The Pakistani rupee has dropped to a record low against the US dollar with the exchange rate sliding to PKR 212, local media reported on Monday. This fall in the value came after traders resorted to panic buying on reports that some commercial banks had run out of foreign currency, reports stated.

100.title: West Indies announce their 13-member squad for ODI series against India
100.article_body: West Indies have announced their 13-member squad for the ODI series against India, which will begin on July 22. Senior all-rounder Jason Holder has been recalled to West Indies' squad, which will be led by Nicholas Pooran. Shai Hope will be West Indies' vice captain. Romario Shepherd and Hayden Walsh Jr have been named as reserve players.

101.title: 5 held for running recruitment scam from fake call centre in Delhi
101.article_body: Five members of a gang involved in over 300 cheating cases were arrested for running a fake call centre in Delhi's Shahdara and cheating people on pretext of providing them airline jobs. Accused would acquire job seekers' information from recruitment website, police said. They were arrested after a man filed a complaint, alleging that he was cheated of ₹6.80 lakh.

102.title: Harbhajan takes oath as Rajya Sabha member, says 'will do my best for the nation'
102.article_body: Former cricketer Harbhajan Singh has taken oath as a member of the Rajya Sabha from Punjab. Sharing a video from the ceremony in Parliament, Singh said, "Took oath...to protect the Constitution, rule of law and dignity of the House. I will do my best for the people of Punjab and the nation..Jai Hind Jai Bharat." He was nominated by AAP.

103.title: Rape accused suspended Hyderabad Inspector sent to police custody
103.article_body: Suspended Hyderabad Police Inspector Nageshwar Rao who is accused of raping a woman was remanded to police custody by a local court on Monday. Vanasthalipuram Police had sought Rao's custody for investigation into the case. Upon grant of custody, Rao was brought to Vanasthalipuram police station from Central Prison Cherlapally by a police team.

104.title: Cough syrup bottles worth ₹1 crore seized in Guwahati, 2 held
104.article_body: Guwahati Police has busted an interstate drugs network and seized a consignment containing 20,000 cough syrup bottles worth over ₹1 crore from a truck, officials said on Monday. The truck was intercepted in Assam's Gorchuk area and the consignment was being transported by truck from Punjab to Manipur. Two persons have been arrested in connection with the bust.

105.title: SC to hear plea seeking to worship 'Shivling' in Gyanvapi premises
105.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to list for hearing a fresh plea seeking its permission to worship the 'Shivling', which is said to be found in the Gyanvapi mosque premises in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi during a court-ordered survey. A bench comprising CJI NV Ramana and Justices Krishna Murari and Hima Kohli posted the matter for hearing on July 21.

106.title: Nearly all B'luru COVID-19 cases were Omicron by Jan end: Study
106.article_body: A study by a genomics-based research company suggests that nearly 100% of COVID-19 cases reported by the end of January 2022 in Bengaluru were driven by Omicron and its sub-lineages. Nearly 30 sub-lineages of the variant were identified, the study said. The study also found that Delta sub-lineages were dominant from July 2021 to October 2021.

107.title: Policeman shoots dead 3 colleagues in Delhi, later surrenders
107.article_body: A policeman posted at the water plant in the Haiderpur area of Delhi shot dead his three colleagues on Monday. The accused and the three victims were from Sikkim Police and they were deployed at the plant for its security as part of the India Reserve Battalion. The accused surrendered at the Samaypur Badli police station, an official said.

108.title: Samantha to be guest at Indian Film Festival of Melbourne 2022
108.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu will be a key guest at the 2022 Indian Film Festival of Melbourne. The actress will be speaking about her own career and trajectory on August 13 before a live audience. The festival will be holding both physical and virtual events after being online for the past two years due to the COVID-19 pandemic and lockdown.

109.title: Man kills live-in partner over money dispute in Delhi, arrested
109.article_body: A 43-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly murdering his live-in partner at their house in Delhi, police said. The accused allegedly strangled the victim to death following an altercation between them over lending money to a neighbour, police said. The accused, along with two others who were also arrested, dumped the victim's body near Yamuna Expressway.

110.title: Run machine, legend-in-the-making: KKR on Smriti Mandhana's 26th birthday
110.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders took to Twitter to wish India Women limited-overs vice-captain Smriti Mandhana on her 26th birthday on Monday. "A run machine and a legend-in-the-making!" wrote KKR. Mumbai Indians tweeted, "Wishing one of the most gifted batters, Smriti, a very happy birthday from one family." Smriti has scored 5,250 runs in 165 international matches so far.

111.title: Period films harder, the world needs to be believable: Ranbir on 'Shamshera'
111.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor stated in an interview that period films like 'Shamshera' are harder because the world it is set in needs to be believable. "Audience...need to know the place and time, they can't be alienated from that. So it's quite tricky," he added. The actor further said that if the story is engaging and entertaining, that's what matters.

112.title: Poor being maligned with talk of 'revadi culture': Priyanka Gandhi
112.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi on Monday criticised PM Narendra Modi, saying that the poor and middle class were being maligned with the talk of "revadi culture", while others were earning indiscriminately. "Earlier, petrol-diesel, cooking gas were made expensive. Today, flour, cereals, and curd have also become expensive," Gandhi said. Electricity will also get expensive soon, she added.

113.title: Pleasing to see them dominate on English soil: Laxman on India's 2-1 ODIs win
113.article_body: After India's 2-1 win in the three-match ODI series against England, VVS Laxman said it is very pleasing to see India dominate on English soil. "A fantastic chase to win the ODI series...partnership between Rishabh Pant and Hardik Pandya was a phenomenal comeback," he added. Sachin Tendulkar said, "Congratulations to Team India...keep up the good work and continue this form."

114.title: Fitness certificate of bus that fell into river in MP was to expire soon
114.article_body: The Maharashtra road transport bus that fell into the Narmada river in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district on Monday was over 10 years old and its fitness certificate was to expire in about 10 days, RTO officials said. At least 12 passengers were killed in the accident. The bus was on its way to Jalgaon district in Maharashtra.

115.title: Hoax bomb threat sent to B'luru school owned by DK Shivakumar
115.article_body: Bengaluru's National Hill View Public School, owned by Congress leader DK Shivakumar, on Monday received a bomb threat that turned out to be a hoax upon a thorough police search. A bomb squad and sniffer dogs were deployed for inspection of the premises, an official said. Shivakumar had suggested the possibility of the threat being a hoax in the morning.

116.title: Jagdeep Dhankhar will be an excellent, inspiring VP: PM Modi
116.article_body: Shortly after NDA Vice Presidential candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar filed his nomination on Monday, PM Narendra Modi said that he will be an excellent and inspiring VP. JP Nadda said Dhankhar is a "Kisan-Putra" (son of a farmer) who has established himself as a "people's governor". I will always strive to enhance the democratic values of India, Dhankhar said.

117.title: Shia group seeks ₹5 cr for renovation of Ashoorkhanas in Hyderabad
117.article_body: Ahead of Muharram, a Shia group has sought a special grant of ₹5 crore from the Telangana Minorities Welfare Ministry for repairs and renovation of Ashoorkhanas (places of mourning). The grant is sought for repairs in Hyderabad and other districts of Telangana. Muharram processions will be taken out in Hyderabad on August 8 and August 9.

118.title: Ex-NSE CEO Chitra's remand extended by 4 days in money laundering case
118.article_body: A Delhi court has extended the four-day remand of former CEO and MD of National Stock Exchange (NSE), Chitra Ramkrishna, in a money laundering case. The case involves alleged phone tapping and snooping of NSE's employees. Earlier, the Enforcement Directorate and CBI registered two more cases against Ramkrishna, former NSE head Ravi Narain and former Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey.

119.title: Governor office neither ornamental nor political: Vice President Naidu
119.article_body: Outgoing Vice President Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday stated that the office of a Governor is "neither an ornamental position nor a political position". He appealed the Governors to ensure that programs funded by the Centre are properly implemented by the states. Governors' conduct should set an example, a media release from Naidu's office quoted him as saying.

120.title: Margaret Alva is a better VP candidate than Dhankhar: Kharge
120.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge has said that the Opposition candidate, Margaret Alva, for the Vice-President elections is a better one than the NDA candidate, Jagdeep Dhankhar. "Our candidate is from the minority and is better than their candidate. If they will support our candidate [Margaret Alva], then it will be a unanimous poll," Kharge said.

121.title: Ben Stokes retires from ODI cricket, says '3 formats are just unsustainable for me now'
121.article_body: England Test captain Ben Stokes has announced his retirement from ODI cricket, saying England's match against South Africa on Tuesday will be his last ODI. "Three formats are just unsustainable for me now," he stated. "It's time for someone else to progress as a cricketer and make incredible memories like I have over the past 11 years," he added.

122.title: Russia instructs its forces to destroy Ukraine's long-range weapons
122.article_body: Russian Defence Minister Sergei Shoigu has instructed the military's Vostok group's commander to prioritise destroying Ukraine's long-range missile and artillery weapons and "continue...intentional incineration of wheat fields," the Russian Defence Ministry said on Monday. Shoigu said that these weapons were being used to "shell residential areas" in the Russia-controlled Donbas region, it added.

123.title: Karnataka fits radio collars on 2 elephants to reduce human-animal conflicts
123.article_body: The Karnataka government's forest department has fitted radio collars on two elephants in MM Hills Wildlife Sanctuary to prevent human-animal conflicts in the nearby areas. A radio collar is a belt equipped with GPS and its real-time monitoring will send early warnings to forest staff. "We have received complaints that two tuskers often enter the village areas," an official said.

124.title: Company supervisor assaulted, robbed after taking shared cab in Gurugram
124.article_body: A private company's supervisor was allegedly assaulted and robbed by three men after the former took a shared cab from Gurugram's Vatika Chowk to Mathura. The accused took a detour and started beating the victim, Ramesh Kumar (45), before snatching two mobile phones and ₹29,000 cash from him, police said. The complaint was lodged at the Badshahpur Police Station.

125.title: Jharkhand woman kills husband for not allowing her to wear jeans
125.article_body: A woman killed her husband in Jharkhand's Jamtara after he allegedly stopped her from wearing jeans after marriage. The woman, Pushpa Hembrom, had an argument with her husband after she went to see a fair wearing jeans. She allegedly attacked him with knife during argument, leaving the victim grievously injured. He was rushed to hospital and later succumbed to injuries.

126.title: MP doctor, gunman frisk patients to seize tobacco; people say ‘inhuman act’
126.article_body: The civil surgeon of the Shahdol district hospital in Madhya Pradesh, while being escorted by a gunman and stick-wielding guards, frisked patients and their attendants to allegedly seize tobacco. Reports said that some people termed the act "inhuman". The surgeon said that this was being done to stop the patients from chewing tobacco and spitting in the hospital.

127.title: Yellow alert issued in Mumbai on Monday, water stock in lakes at 82%
127.article_body: IMD issued a yellow alert in Mumbai on Monday, even as the rain subsided in most parts of the state over the weekend. However, the water stock in lakes because of heavy rain is now at 82%, with three lakes having already overflowed. Furthermore, two more rain-related deaths were reported on Sunday, taking the season's total to 104 in Maharashtra.

128.title: 20 trains on Mumbai-Delhi route cancelled after train derails in Guj
128.article_body: 20 trains on the Mumbai-Delhi route have been cancelled and about 16 trains diverted after a goods train derailed on Monday in Gujarat. According to Western Railway, wagons of the goods train that were meant to transport coal were running empty when they overturned. Eyewitnesses told police and railway officials that the wagons derailed with a deafening noise.

129.title: Droupadi Murmu will win Prez polls by a huge margin: Karnataka CM
129.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai has said that the BJP-led NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu will win the polls by a "huge majority". "There is every possibility of Murmu breaking all previous records in her margin of victory. Murmu is the personification of noble humane values," CM Bommai said. "Murmu has received support from several [non-NDA] parties too," he added.

130.title: ED questions Satyendar Jain's wife in money laundering case
130.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Monday questioned Delhi Minister Satyendar Jain's wife, Poonam Jain, in connection with a money laundering case. Earlier, Poonam was summoned by the ED on July 14. This comes months after the ED arrested Satyendar Jain on May 30 in connection with alleged hawala transactions related to a Kolkata-based company.

131.title: Rare white whale washes up on a beach in Australia, pic surfaces
131.article_body: A rare white whale washed up on a Victorian beach in Australia. Several people believed the whale that washed up to be the famous humpback Migaloo, which was first spotted off Byron Bay in 1991. However, the local environment department confirmed that it isn't Migaloo. Officials confirmed that the white whale is a sub-adult female, while Migaloo is a male.

132.title: Compensate COVID victims' families without wasting time: SC to states
132.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday asked all states and Union Territories to pay compensation to the family members of COVID-19 victims without wasting any time. The court said that if any claimant has a grievance, they may approach the grievance redressal committee. The committee will have to decide the application of the claimant within four weeks.

133.title: Fortune cooking oil prices cut by up to ₹30 per litre by Adani Wilmar
133.article_body: Prices of one of the most popular Indian edible oil brands Fortune have been cut by up to ₹30 per litre amid a fall in global prices. This is the second oil price reduction announced by the brand's maker Adani Wilmar in two months. Prices of soyabean and sunflower oils have been cut to ₹165 and ₹195 per litre, respectively.

134.title: Deepika Padukone to play Parvati in 'Brahmastra 2': Report
134.article_body: Deepika Padukone will portray Parvati in 'Brahmastra 2', according to a report. The actress will reportedly also make a cameo appearance in 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva', which is set to release in theatres on September 9. The upcoming film, starring Ranbir Kapoor, Amitabh Bachchan, Alia Bhatt and Nagarjuna Akkineni, will be released in multiple languages.

135.title: In a first, Cong fought Gwalior civic polls without Scindia and won: Digvijaya
135.article_body: Former Madhya Pradesh CM Digvijaya Singh has commented on Congress winning the Gwalior Municipal Corporation on Sunday. "For the first time, Congress fought the Gwalior local body polls without [Congress-turned BJP leader] Jyotiraditya Scindia and won it," Digvijaya said. He added, "This win should be noted by political observers." Notably, Scindia belongs to the Gwalior-based royal family.

136.title: Leopard rushed to police station after people climb cage for selfies in Gujarat
136.article_body: A caged leopard had to be rushed to the police station 10 km away after locals climbed on the cage and started taking selfies and videos of it in Gujarat. People rushed in large numbers to see the leopard and forest officials had a tough time controlling the mob. We covered the cage but public continued taking videos, officials said.

137.title: Rajesh Khanna was very generous, he bought houses for co-stars: Sharmila
137.article_body: Veteran actress Sharmila Tagore, who appeared with Rajesh Khanna in multiple films, has revealed that the late actor used to buy expensive gifts for his co-actors, colleagues and friends. "I have seen him be very generous...Sometimes he even bought them a house but in return, it seems Kaka had great expectations of them, which eventually strained his relations," Sharmila added.

138.title: Love you SRK for rehearsing with me, not throwing attitude: Kashmera on 'Yes..'
138.article_body: Actress Kashmera Shah took to Instagram to share a video from 'Yes Boss' and thanked actor Shah Rukh Khan for his support. "Today I completed 25 years in the Bollywood film industry...Thank you King Khan for putting me at comfort...Love you always for rehearsing with me and not throwing attitude of being the huge star that you were," she wrote.

139.title: COVID-19 outbreak at resort in China leaves 2,000 stranded
139.article_body: Over 2,000 tourists are stranded in the city of Beihai in China's Guangxi region after over 450 people tested positive for coronavirus over five days at a resort there, state media Global Times reported. Of the total, 444 were asymptomatic, according to a press briefing. The city is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Guangxi, the report said.

140.title: B'luru parks to remain open for extra hours following public demand
140.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has extended the timings of all parks within its limits by two and a half hours and now they will remain open from 5 am to 8 pm. Earlier, the parks used to open only from 5 am to 10 am and 4 pm to 8 pm. The decision was taken following public demand.

141.title: Convict who escaped Pune jail by removing roof tiles rearrested
141.article_body: Pune Rural Police have rearrested a 22-year-old convict who had fled from the Shirur police station last month. The accused, identified as Rohan Biru Sontakke, who is reportedly a history-sheeter, escaped after removing the roof tiles of the washroom attached to the lockup in the wee hours of June 23. Police nabbed Sontakke on Saturday after receiving a tip-off.

142.title: We're not getting to spend as much time together as I'd want: Janhvi on family
142.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor said in an interview that she would love to do a film with her actor-brother Arjun Kapoor. "We're all working so much, we're not getting to spend as much time together as a family as I'd want us to," she said, adding, "So I think the only way...to get...family together is to...do a film and cast everyone in...family."

143.title: I'd have definitely tried to hit another one: Sehwag on Pant's 5 consecutive fours
143.article_body: Team India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant smashed five consecutive fours off England pacer David Willey in the 42nd over in their final ODI on Sunday. Reacting to it, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said, "I'd have definitely tried to hit [another] four or a six." India needed four runs to win off Willey's last delivery but Pant took a single.

144.title: When it was time to give relief, we burdened people: Varun on new GST rate
144.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi criticised the central government over the latest increase in GST rates and said that when it was time to give people "relief", we are burdening them. Taking to Twitter, he wrote, "This decision, taken amid record-breaking unemployment, will further lighten the pockets of middle-class families and especially the struggling youth living in rented houses."

145.title: Helicopter returning after helping firefighters crashes in US; 4 dead
145.article_body: Four people died after a helicopter of Bernalillo County Sheriff's Office crashed near Las Vegas in US' New Mexico while it was returning after helping firefighters in another city in the state, authorities said on Sunday. The deceased include three personnel from the sheriff's office and one county firefighter. The cause of the incident is unknown and will be investigated.

146.title: Asked Musk how many kids he plans to have, he said 'Mars needs people': Mark Cuban
146.article_body: Billionaire Mark Cuban said that he once asked Elon Musk how many children he planned on having. "This was before the last three or whatever it was," Cuban said, likely referring to the three children Musk fathered in 2021. "I'm like, 'Dude, congratulations, how many you going to have?' He sends me a text back, 'Mars needs people'," Cuban recalled.

147.title: Solar storm to hit Earth tomorrow, may cause radio & GPS disruptions
147.article_body: A solar flare or solar storm that erupted from the Sun on July 14 is expected to hit Earth and disrupt radio and GPS signals early on July 19, experts have warned. Space weather expert Dr Tamitha Skov said that strong aurora or polar lights will also possibly be seen on Earth due to the solar storm.

148.title: Want to show people I'm more than simple, innocent: Janhvi on 'Good...'
148.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has said 'Good Luck Jerry' is a good opportunity to show people that she is more than simple, innocent and helpless. "I saw the original film...thought it was cool and funny...Nayanthara was just such a bada** in the film," she stated. Janhvi added, "Nayanthara in that film was...innocent and simple, but her character had a solid arc."

149.title: Rupee closes at an all-time low of 79.98 against US dollar
149.article_body: The rupee on Monday hit a fresh record low as it ended closer to the 80-mark to close at 79.98 against the US dollar. This was the seventh consecutive session when the rupee weakened. So far this year, the currency has weakened 7.05% against the US dollar. Meanwhile, BSE Sensex closed 760 points higher at 54,521 on Monday.

150.title: It's invaluable to have Hardik in Team India in white-ball cricket: Jaffer
150.article_body: Wasim Jaffer has said it's invaluable to have all-rounder Hardik Pandya in the Indian team in white-ball cricket. Hardik registered bowling figures of 7-3-24-4 and scored 71(55) in India's five-wicket win against England in third ODI. It was the 28-year-old's best-ever bowling figures in ODI cricket. India won the three-match ODI series 2-1. Hardik was adjudged 'Player of the Series'

151.title: That's the example you give: Zaheer on Hardik-Rishabh's 133 run partnership
151.article_body: Ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan has said the partnership between Rishabh Pant and Hardik Pandya in the third England ODI is the "example you'd like to give to anyone who is in the batting lineup". India were 72/4 when Hardik came in to bat alongside Pant. The duo added 133 runs for the fifth wicket, helping India win by five wickets.

152.title: HUL, ITC, United Spirits added 130 execs to crorepati club last fiscal: Report
152.article_body: Hindustan Unilever (HUL), ITC and United Spirits together added over 130 executives to the club of those earning more than ₹1 crore annually during the last fiscal, The Economic Times reported. United Spirits witnessed a massive jump of 113%, whereas HUL and ITC saw 33% and 44% increase in the number of eight-figure salary earners, as per their annual reports.

153.title: SRK's look from 'Dunki' leaked, actor spotted shooting in London
153.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's look from his upcoming film 'Dunki' has been leaked on social media. The actor was seen wearing a half-tucked plaid shirt along with black trousers and sporting a messy hair look while going for a shot on London's Waterloo Bridge. The film is directed by Rajkumar Hirani and also features Taapsee Pannu.

154.title: GST is now Gayi Saari Tankhvaah: Akhilesh criticises BJP over GST rates hike
154.article_body: SP chief Akhilesh Yadav has criticised the BJP-led Centre over the latest hike in GST rates by coining a new term for it "Gayi Saari Tankhvaah [Gone all salary]". This new term came because of the disappointment with the increased “burden” on the earnings of common citizens due to the hike in GST rates, Yadav said.

155.title: Stopped working with Rajesh Khanna, he came at 12pm for 9am shoot: Sharmila
155.article_body: Veteran actress Sharmila Tagore has revealed that the one thing about late actor Rajesh Khanna that affected her was his habit of coming late for work. The actress added that he never reached before 12pm for a 9am shift. "And that's why I decided to work with other actors despite knowing that our pairing was quite successful," Sharmila said.

156.title: BJP’s nomination of Murmu a 'masterstroke': Congress leader Rathva
156.article_body: Senior Gujarat Congress leader Sukhram Rathva on Monday said that fielding Droupadi Murmu, a tribal woman candidate for the post of President, was a "masterstroke" by the BJP.  "I hope that whoever gets elected to the post of President, he or she will implement the provisions of the Constitution," said Rathva.

157.title: BBMP collected ₹1.14 crore fine for plastic ban violations: Report
157.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike reportedly collected ₹1.14 crore in penalty for violating the single-use plastic rule between September 2019 and June 2022. On Saturday alone, the civic body seized 122.3 kg of single-use plastic from 98 locations in the city and collected ₹77,100 as a fine on the same day. Manufacturers, retailers and small-scale business vendors were among the violators.

158.title: 8 out of 13 bodies of MP bus mishap victims identified, 5 from Maharashtra
158.article_body: Authorities have identified eight out of 13 bodies of victims who lost their lives in Madhya Pradesh's bus mishap on Monday. Officials said that five of those identified belonged to Maharashtra. Two others have been traced back to Rajasthan and one to Madhya Pradesh. Bus driver and conductor are among those killed in the incident. Their bodies have been recovered.

159.title: Hyderabad student bags all-India 3rd rank in ICSE Class 10 results
159.article_body: Hyderabad's Riya Susan Tony bagged all-India third rank in ICSE Class 10 results that were declared by CISCE on Sunday evening. Riya, a student of The Future Kid's School, secured 99.4% by scoring 497 marks out of 500. The third rank is being shared by 72 candidates as all of them scored 497 marks in the Class 10 board examination.

160.title: Hardik now knows when to bowl bouncer, there's better planning: RP Singh
160.article_body: Former India pacer RP Singh has said all-rounder Hardik Pandya has improved as a bowler after coming back from his back injury. "Earlier, Hardik used to run in hard and send down short balls. But now, he thinks hard and knows when to bowl the bouncer," explained Singh. Hardik registered his career-best ODI figures of 4/24 against England.

161.title: I'm not a criminal: Kejriwal over delay in nod for Singapore visit
161.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Monday said that he wasn't a "criminal", stressing that there's a "political reason" behind the delay in granting him permission to visit Singapore for a summit. Kejriwal said he was specially invited to the World Cities Summit in Singapore, where he would present the Delhi model before world leaders and bring laurels to India.

162.title: India reports its second monkeypox case in Kerala
162.article_body: India's second positive case of monkeypox has been confirmed in Kerala, the state's Health Ministry said on Monday. The case has been reported in Kerala's Kannur district, the state government said. The first case of the virus in the country was also reported in Kerala last week when a traveller from UAE tested positive.

163.title: Fraser-Pryce sets championship record in Jamaican sweep of women's 100m
163.article_body: Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce won her fifth world title in Jamaican female sprinters' clean sweep of the women's 100m in the ongoing World Athletics Championships. Fraser-Pryce won gold with a new championship record of 10.67 seconds. Shericka Jackson was second, clocking a personal best of 10.73 seconds, while the Tokyo Olympic champion Elaine Thompson-Herah finished third (10.81s).

164.title: Focussed on one ball at a time: Pant on match-winning ton vs England
164.article_body: Talking about his match-winning innings against England in third and final ODI, India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant said he was focussing on one ball at a time. "When your team is under pressure and you bat like that...something I aspire to do," he added. Chasing 260, Pant hit an unbeaten 125 to help India score 261/5 in 42.1 overs.

165.title: 'PS-1' director Mani Ratnam receives legal notice over Vikram's look: Report
165.article_body: Filmmaker Mani Ratnam and actor Vikram have reportedly received a legal notice from a lawyer over Vikram's look in the film 'Ponniyin Selvan'. As per the reports, the lawyer alleged Cholas didn't have a 'tilak' on the forehead. In the posters released earlier, Vikram, who plays Aditya Karikalan in the film, can be seen sporting a 'tilak'.

166.title: Grace & style of Dhanush is something to behold: Regé-Jean Page
166.article_body: Regé-Jean Page, speaking about Dhanush in 'The Gray Man', said, "The grace...style and badassery of that man, is something to behold...that's going to be a thunderbolt in the film." "If Batman was twice as badass, then he might get halfway to where Dhanush is in this film," he added. Ryan Gosling and Chris Evans feature in the film.

167.title: Some pap pics look vulgar, then people character assassinate you: Janhvi
167.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor has stated that sometimes photos taken by paparazzi can look vulgar because they are "taken at a certain angle" or she is "photographed in a certain way". "People perceive you in a certain way and they character assassinate you, even though you make choices based on your comfort. That bothers me," the actress said.

168.title: How does the ODI team rankings table read after India's series victory?
168.article_body: Following their 2-1 ODI series victory against England, India are placed third on the ICC ODI team rankings table. India have accumulated 109 rating points, while fourth-placed Pakistan have 106 rating points. England are currently second with 121 rating points, while New Zealand lead the rankings with 128 rating points.

169.title: Moosewala's father cries while unveiling his statue, says 'can't see son as statue at 28'
169.article_body: Late singer Sidhu Moosewala's father Balkaur Singh broke down while unveiling a 6.5 feet statue of his son in Punjab's Mansa recently. "I can't bear to see my son as a statue at 28. We wait for justice. The killers, whether sitting on foreign soil or here, should be punished," he said. Sidhu Moosewala was shot dead on May 29.

170.title: Delighted to win civic polls in Gwalior; BJP has crash-landed: Jairam Ramesh
170.article_body: After winning the Gwalior Municipal Corporation, Congress MP Jairam Ramesh said, "Nothing has given me greater pleasure than the victory in Gwalior local body polls." "BJP has crash-landed there," Ramesh said. Notably, Gwalior and its nearby districts, including Guna, are considered as the family bastion of the Congress-turned BJP politician Jyotiraditya Scindia.

171.title: Emu runs on road, disrupts traffic in US' Texas; videos surface
171.article_body: Videos of an emu, a flightless bird, running loose on the road and disrupting traffic in Houston in US' Texas have surfaced online. According to local media, the emu was captured and returned to its owners safely. One of the videos of the incident showed three police cars following the emu as it walks on the streets in the area.

172.title: Rejected 'Judwaa 2', didn't want to do 'bachpan ka role': Siddharth Nigam
172.article_body: Actor Siddharth Nigam has revealed that he was offered to play Varun Dhawan's childhood character in the 2017 film 'Judwaa 2'. "I didn't want to do a 'bachpan ka role'. Otherwise, it becomes difficult to get roles as a male lead," he added. Siddharth further said he decided not to do "popular actors' bachpan ka role" after doing 'Dhoom 3'.

173.title: Tamil Nadu CM gets discharged from hospital, votes in Presidential poll
173.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin was discharged from Chennai's Kauvery Hospital on Monday after recovering from COVID-19 and went directly to the Secretariat complex to cast his vote in the Presidential poll. The ruling DMK and its allies are backing Opposition choice former Union Minister Yashwant Sinha. AIADMK is supporting Droupadi Murmu who is the nominee fielded by BJP.

174.title: School bus driver rapes 15-yr-old Dalit student in Pune, arrested
174.article_body: Pune Police have arrested a school bus driver for allegedly raping a 15-year-old Dalit student. According to police, accused contacted the girl on Saturday while she was attending tuition classes and later took her to a dilapidated building where he allegedly raped her. A case of rape has been filed under sections of IPC, POCSO Act and SC/ST Atrocities Act.

175.title: 2023 K'taka polls my last, won't contest from Chamundeshwari: Siddaramaiah
175.article_body: Congress leader and former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has said that 2023 Assembly elections would be his last. "I'm making it very very clear...I will not contest from Chamundeshwari again," he added.
