351.title: Bengaluru delivery boy was killed over street fight, not Urdu: CID
351.article_body: Bengaluru delivery boy Chandru V, who was murdered in April, was killed over a street altercation and not over the Urdu language, the Karnataka CID has said in its chargesheet. Earlier, Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra had claimed that the victim was killed for not knowing Urdu. He later withdrew his claim after a police fact-check discredited the angle.

352.title: Congress candidate dies of heart attack after losing municipal council polls in MP
352.article_body: A Congress candidate died due to a heart attack after he lost the municipal council election in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa on Sunday. The candidate, Harinarayan Gupta, had contested the elections from ward number nine in the Hanumana area. Independent candidate Akhilesh Gupta defeated him by 14 votes. Harinarayan was also the mandal president of the Congress unit in Hanumana.

353.title: AIUDF to support Yashwant Sinha in upcoming Presidential elections
353.article_body: The All India United Democratic Front (AIUDF) on Sunday said that it will vote for the Opposition's Presidential candidate Yashwant Sinha in upcoming elections. AIUDF leader Aminul Islam said that the party will back Sinha even as it was "sidelined" during Sinha's recent visit to Assam to seek support for his candidature. Presidential elections will be held on July 18.

354.title: Over 80 displaced animals, birds rescued amid heavy rains in Mumbai
354.article_body: Over 80 displaced animals and birds were rescued from various parts of Mumbai in the last few days amid heavy rains in the city. As many as seven turtles were found in different parts of the city, a forest official said. Over 35 snakes of different species were rescued from residential and commercial areas, the official said.

355.title: Garuda Aerospace drones being used in Gujarat, Andhra floods
355.article_body: Chennai-based startup Garuda Aerospace's drones, which were developed for Swiggy deliveries, were used in Gujarat and Andhra Pradesh to deliver food and medicines during the floods. Agnishwar Jayaprakash, Founder and CEO of Garuda Aerospace, said that to support NDRF officials, Garuda Aerospace teams were deployed in Vadodara and Guntur. Previously, the drones were used during the Assam floods.

356.title: Nepali couple among 3 arrested for stealing ₹1 cr valuables in Hyd
356.article_body: Hyderabad's Cyberabad Police has arrested a Nepali couple and their associate for allegedly stealing valuables worth ₹1 crore from the house of the couple's employer in Kukatpally. According to police, the accused husband and wife were living in a servant quarter. The robbery was committed while the employer and his family were away for a ceremony, police said.

357.title: Terrorism, cyber crime challenges before Mumbai Police: Commissioner
357.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Vivek Phansalkar has said tackling terrorism and cyber crime are major challenges for the police, but efforts are on to keep the metropolis terror-free. "Safety of women and prevention of crime against them is our priority," Phansalkar said. Mumbai Police is also taking necessary steps to make police stations and security personnel child-friendly, he added.

358.title: Centre's observer reviews Prez poll preparation at T'gana Assembly in Hyd
358.article_body: Central government observer Krishna Kumar Dwivedi on Saturday reviewed preparations at the Telangana Legislative Assembly in Hyderabad for the presidential elections due on Monday. Dwivedi interacted with the assembly secretary, V Narsimha Charyulu and other officials. He was given a tour of the assembly premises and polling station.

359.title: Opp'n trying to belittle the image of Parliament: Union Minister
359.article_body: Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Sunday criticised the Opposition, saying it was making issues out of non-issues and trying to belittle the image of Parliament. "No word has been barred from use in Parliament and the Lok Sabha Secretariat has been bringing out such a list of unparliamentary words since 1954," Joshi added.

360.title: Indian team is struggling because Kohli is not among the runs: Akmal
360.article_body: Pakistani cricketer Kamran Akmal said Team India is struggling because Virat Kohli is not among the runs, adding the side is heavily dependent on the batter. "He has single-handedly won so many games for India...when he comes out of the rut, India's performance will also improve," he further said. Kohli scored 16 in India's 100-run loss against England at Lord's.

361.title: Ex-K'taka minister influencing probe: Deceased contractor's wife
361.article_body: Deceased contractor Santosh Patil's wife, Jayashree Patil, has alleged that the main accused in her husband's suicide case, former Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa, is influencing the police investigation in his favour. She has cited Eshwarappa's statement to substantiate her claim wherein he had purportedly said that he would be acquitted of the charges in 15 days.

362.title: Sushmita reacts to being called 'gold digger' for dating Lalit Modi, says she's self made
362.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen took to Twitter to react to being called a 'gold digger' for dating ex-IPL Chairman Lalit Modi. Sushmita praised an article that called out trolls for attacking her over her relationship with Lalit. Alongside the article, she wrote, "A self made woman." "Ma'am these people (trolls) are just jealous souls," a Twitter user commented on Sushmita's post.

363.title: She yet again demonstrated her exceptional talent: PM on Sindhu winning Singapore Open
363.article_body: Congratulating PV Sindhu on winning her first-ever Singapore Open title, PM Narendra Modi tweeted, "She has yet again demonstrated her exceptional sporting talent and achieved success." He added, "It is a proud moment for the country and will also give inspiration to upcoming players." Notably, Sindhu has won three titles in 2022 so far.

364.title: Probe initiated to find how Delhi couple got away with 25 guns
364.article_body: Delhi customs has initiated an inquiry to find out how a married couple was successful in smuggling 25 guns into the country in December last year via the international airport. The guns were smuggled from Turkey. The couple was arrested recently for allegedly smuggling 45 guns, worth ₹22.5 lakh, into the country at the Indira Gandhi International (IGI) airport.

365.title: ICSE Class 10 results declared, 99.97% pass the exam
365.article_body: The Council for the Indian School Certificate Examinations (CISCE) has declared the results of the Class 10 board exams or ICSE exams. Four students have secured All India Rank 1 with 99.8% marks, while 34 students have secured the second rank with 99.6%, PTI reported. Pass percentage of students is 99.97%.

366.title: IAF to hold 2-day Avionics Indigenisation Seminar in Pune from Monday
366.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) is going to host a two-day Avionics Indigenisation Seminar, AVISEM-22, in Pune from Monday. The theme of the seminar will be 'Indigenisation of Avionics Aggregates Based on Modular Open System Architecture Framework'. The objective is to evolve a strategy to reduce the dependence on foreign manufacturers for the supply and maintenance of avionics, IAF said.

367.title: Have received 7.5 lakh Agnipath applications; youths are keen: IAF chief
367.article_body: IAF chief, Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari, has said that the force has received 7.5 lakh applications under the Agnipath scheme. "This shows the keenness of the youth to join the armed forces. The big challenge lies in finishing the selection process on time to start training in December," Chaudhari said. Notably, the Agnipath scheme had sparked protests across India.

368.title: 15 staff suspended, 35 transferred in Bengaluru's Central Prison
368.article_body: The government suspended 15 officials attached to Bengaluru's Central Prison and transferred 35 to other jails for dereliction of duty. Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra said the officials were allowing prisoners special treatment including the use of mobile phones and drugs inside the jail. The move comes after the first meeting of the newly formed Karnataka State Prison Development Board.

369.title: 4 Pune dams now have enough water to meet city's yearly requirement
369.article_body: The collective water stock in four dams that supply drinking water to Pune has increased to 16 TMC amid rains, which is equivalent to the city's yearly requirement. The dams of Panshet, Varasgaon, Temghar and Khadakwasla now hold over 50% water of their collective water storage capacity. Meanwhile, IMD has issued a yellow alert for Pune till July 18.

370.title: Whenever Jagdeep Dhankhar takes up task he completes it: Brother Randeep
370.article_body: NDA's Vice-President candidate Jagdeep Dhankhar's brother, Randeep, has commented on his brother's abilities. "We had not expected this. When he became the West Bengal Governor, we did not know even then," Randeep said. He added, "Whenever my brother takes any task into his hands, he works hard to complete it. When he did advocacy...his clients used to get positive results."

371.title: Centre summons all-party meeting on Sri Lanka crisis on July 19
371.article_body: Centre has summoned an all-party meeting to discuss ongoing crisis in Sri Lanka on Tuesday, the second day of Monsoon session of Parliament. The meeting will be briefed by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar. This comes as both DMK and AIADMK sought India's intervention on issue, especially to address concerns regarding Sri Lanka's Tamil population.

372.title: Rajamouli wanted to direct 'Bajrangi...', couldn't over 'Baahubali': Writer
372.article_body: 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' writer KV Vijayendra Prasad revealed his son SS Rajamouli wanted to direct the Salman Khan-starrer. He said he narrated the story to Rajamouli who cried but asked him to give the film away. "Once the film...released, he...said, 'Papa...I was shooting the climax of 'Baahubali 1'...Had you asked me 10 days before or later, I'd have directed'," Prasad added.

373.title: Former UP MLC arrested in Mumbai by Saharanpur Police
373.article_body: A former member of the Uttar Pradesh Legislative Council, Mahmood Ali, was arrested in Mumbai by the Saharanpur Police. Ali is the brother of former MLC Haji Iqbal, who is allegedly a member of a mining mafia, police said. Iqbal's three sons are already arrested in various cases. Notably, Iqbal and Ali were BSP MLCs from 2010-2016 and 2016-2022 respectively.

374.title: B'luru Police arrests 3 individuals with drugs worth ₹90 lakh
374.article_body: Bengaluru Police has arrested three individuals, including two women, who were involved in the illicit drugs trade, a senior official said on Saturday. Drugs like hashish oil and ganja have been recovered from their possession, the official added. The seized items have an approximate value of ₹90 lakh, the official said.

375.title: Margaret Alva named Opposition's candidate for post of Vice President of India
375.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar announced that Congress leader Margaret Alva is Opposition's candidate for the post of Vice President of India. Alva has earlier served as a Union Minister and has also served as Governor of several states including Gujarat and Goa. On Saturday, West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar was announced as BJP-led NDA's candidate for Vice President post.

376.title: 'The Office' star Craig Robinson cancels show after gunman opens fire in US club
376.article_body: 'The Office' star Craig Robinson cancelled his show after a gunman opened fire at a comedy club in North Carolina, US, where the comedian was scheduled to perform. "I'm safe... It was wild. I was in the green room and they're like, 'Everybody get out!' It was a moment for sure," Robinson said in video posted on Instagram.

377.title: Possible candidate for next India captain: Saba Karim on Rishabh Pant
377.article_body: Praising Rishabh Pant, Saba Karim said the India wicketkeeper-batter is a special player and has match-winning abilities. "I believe that he can emerge as a big player for India in all three formats. Looking at his performances overseas...we can say that he's a possible candidate for...next captain," he added. Pant led India in T20I series against South Africa last month.

378.title: I was mistaken for Anil after 'JugJugg Jeeyo' screening: Sanjay
378.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor revealed he was mistaken for his elder brother Anil Kapoor after the screening of 'JugJugg Jeeyo'. He said a fan told him he was fantastic in the film, adding that he told her, "Thank you...I'll convey it to my brother." "It used to happen a lot. People used to get confused between Anil and [me]," Sanjay said.

379.title: No dearth of selfish people among Dalits, marginalised: Mayawati
379.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati has alleged that there is no shortage of selfish people in Dalits and other neglected groups and has asked her party workers to beware of them. "There is no dearth of selfish people...some of them are even my family relatives," Mayawati tweeted. She added that these people have got several bogus social organisations registered.

380.title: B'luru Metro sees highest footfall in June 2022 since start of COVID-19
380.article_body: In June 2022, the Bengaluru Metro saw highest footfall since the COVID-19 pandemic began. On June 4, 5,07,450 people took the Namma Metro, which is highest figure after March 2020, according to Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Limited. On June 6, revenue of ₹1,29,82,164 was collected, which is said to be the highest daily revenue after the COVID-19 outbreak.

381.title: Govt ready to discuss any issue in Parliament: Pralhad Joshi
381.article_body: Ahead of the monsoon session of Parliament, Union Minister Pralhad Joshi on Sunday said the government is ready to discuss any issue, under rules and procedures of Parliament. "We invited 45 political parties of which 36 attended all-party meeting today, 36 leaders put forth their views, gave suggestions and demanded some issues to be discussed by government," he added.

382.title: Hyderabad man dies of electrocution while urinating near electric pole
382.article_body: A 40-year-old man died on Saturday due to electrocution while he was urinating near an electric pole in Saidabad's Dhobi Ghat area. The deceased, identified as Karim Bhai, was a truck driver from Gujarat and he had arrived in town to unload groceries at a business in Madannapet Mandi when the event occurred, as per reports.

383.title: Foreigners are creating cloudbursts in India: Telangana CM amid floods
383.article_body: Amid floods in parts of Telangana and other Indian states, Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao (KCR) said a "new phenomenon" called cloudburst is being noticed now. "Some are saying there are a few conspiracies involved. I don't know how much truth there is to it," said KCR. "Few people from other countries are doing cloudbursts in India," he added.

384.title: Losing in quarters or semis was upsetting, finally I got this win: Sindhu
384.article_body: Shuttler PV Sindhu has said winning the Singapore Open title, which is her third title victory of the year, "means a lot" to her. "Back then in a couple of tournaments, there were many hard-fought matches and losing in the quarter-finals or semi-finals was very upsetting...and I have finally got the win. I hope this tempo continues," stated Sindhu.

385.title: Such a threat: Bhogle on Siraj's double-wicket maiden over in 3rd England ODI
385.article_body: Team India pacer Mohammed Siraj bowled a double-wicket maiden over, dismissing Jonny Bairstow and Joe Root on ducks, in the ongoing third ODI against England at Old Trafford. Reacting to this, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "When Siraj takes the ball away, he becomes such a threat. I feared he was becoming a scrambled seam inward slant bowler. Excellent over."

386.title: Camaraderie with Rohit has been really good: Suryakumar
386.article_body: India batter Suryakumar Yadav said his camaraderie with skipper Rohit Sharma has been really good. "He's been watching me...talking to me since I played domestic cricket in Mumbai," he added. "I've really felt him on the ground whenever he's leading. I've learned a lot from him...happy that he has shown a lot of confidence in me," he further said.

387.title: Will see if unparliamentary words list imposed in draconian way: Tharoor
387.article_body: Amid the unparliamentary words row, Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said he would "speak normally" in the House and see whether the list of words is applied in a "draconian manner" to oppress meaningful criticism. A ruling by one presiding officer is not necessarily binding on another, so I would treat this list as indicative rather than definitive, he said.

388.title: Virat Kohli dances during warmup ahead of series decider, video goes viral
388.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing former Team India captain Virat Kohli dancing during warmup ahead of the ODI series decider against England in Manchester. "The most entertaining cricketer of recent times," a fan tweeted. "He knows how to absorb pressure," wrote another. India are bowling first in the series decider.

389.title: Shiv Sena will rejoice if Uddhav and Shinde reunite: Sanjay Raut
389.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut on Sunday said that it will be a "happier moment" for the party if Uddhav Thackeray and Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde reunite. Marathi actress Deepali Sayed had previously expressed her happiness over the news of Uddhav and Shinde coming together for discussions keeping the sentiments of Shiv Sainiks in mind.

390.title: Centre declared this year’s floods in Assam as 'severe natural calamity': CM
390.article_body: The Centre has declared this year’s floods in Assam as a "severe natural calamity", CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said. "We had not witnessed a flood of this magnitude. Our priority was to evacuate affected people to relief camps, ensure their safety, provide medical aid and help them return home after the water receded. The task was challenging," CM added.

391.title: Bus carrying BMP jawans overturns as driver falls asleep, 23 jawans injured
391.article_body: A bus carrying Bihar Military Police (BMP) jawans overturned in Malaypur area of Bihar's Jamui on Sunday. 23 BMP jawans were injured in the incident. The bus reached Jamui as part of security arrangements for Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's programme on July 18. All injured jawans were moved to Sadar Hospital for treatment. Police said it appears driver fell asleep.

392.title: All Karnataka BJP MLAs moved to B'luru hotel ahead of Presidential election
392.article_body: All 121 Karnataka BJP MLAs have been shifted to a Bengaluru hotel ahead of the Presidential election on July 18. BJP chief whip M Satish Reddy has asked the MLAs to remain in the hotel until Monday morning. A BJP MLA said, "High command wants to send out a message of how serious our party is about Droupadi Murmu's candidature."

393.title: BJP nominated Dhankhar as VP candidate for political gains: Adhir Chowdhury
393.article_body: Congress leader Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury said that the BJP has nominated Jagdeep Dhankhar as their Vice Presidential candidate for political gains like for getting Jat votes as there are polls coming up in Rajasthan. We don't have any problem with his candidature, he added. BJP President JP Nadda announced Dhankhar's name as NDA's Vice President of India candidate on Saturday.

394.title: Mumbai man kills wife for not letting him sleep next to her
394.article_body: A 58-year-old man allegedly killed his wife by hitting her with a stone slab, after the latter didn't allow him to sleep next to her, in Mumbai's Malad area. The accused, Gyandev Ganpat Balade, was charged with a murder case after he surrendered himself to the police. The deceased's head was crushed entirely by the stone slab, police said.

395.title: Teen killed by 15 in emergency ward as hospital staff watch in Ludhiana
395.article_body: A 15-year-old boy was hacked to death by 15 people with swords and axes in the emergency ward of a civil hospital in Ludhiana on Thursday night. Two people have been arrested for the murder of the victim Savan Kumar. The incident was caught on CCTV showing hospital staff standing as the group killed the teen.

396.title: Robin Hood Army to complete serving 100 millionth meal soon
396.article_body: Robin Hood Army, a volunteer-based organization announced that it will complete serving the 100 millionth meal without raising a single rupee soon. The RHA, which is spread across 328 cities with 1,90,000+ Robins, revealed that it believes that everyone should be independent of hunger, which marks the base of their #Mission75 on the account of the 75th Independence Day.

397.title: Tourists fined ₹63,400 for flouting norms at Pune's Bhimashankar
397.article_body: Pune Rural Police have taken action against at least 18 tourists for flouting norms at Bhimashankar. The tourists were allegedly dancing to loud music on the road and didn't pay heed, after which, police seized their music systems and vehicles last week. The tourists, who comprised college students, were produced at a local court and fined ₹63,400.

398.title: There are songs in 'Brahmastra' that I've hidden away from Alia: Ayan
398.article_body: 'Brahmastra' director Ayan Mukerji revealed there are songs that he has "hidden away" from actress Alia Bhatt. During an Instagram Live session, a fan asked Ayan about the number of songs his film has. To this, he replied, "I wouldn't like to reveal this at this time actually...There are songs (in Brahmastra) that I have hidden away even from Alia."

399.title: BJP MLA's aide slaps toll staffer in Rajasthan, incident caught on camera
399.article_body: BJP MLA Sanjay Sharma's aide has been caught on camera slapping a toll plaza staffer in Rajasthan's Dausa. The incident occurred after the toll worker asked for the MLA's identity card which reportedly infuriated the aide. Sharma remained seated inside the car as his aide emerged from the car and threatened the staffer before slapping him.

400.title: When given responsibility, Hardik is a completely different cricketer: Shastri
400.article_body: Ex-Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said Hardik Pandya is a completely different cricketer when given extra responsibilities. "He was picked by Gujarat Titans, where he was given the extra responsibility of captaining, which did him a world of good," added Shastri. Hardik was named Team India captain in the two-match T20I series against Ireland, which India won 2-0.

401.title: How many times did Manmohan ji attend all-party meet?: BJP to Congress
401.article_body: Reacting to the criticism of Congress party over PM Narendra Modi's absence in the all-party meet held today, BJP's Pralhad Joshi said that before 2014 no PM used to attend all-party meet. "Congress's Jairam Ramesh raised issue that PM didn't attend the meeting today...How many times did Manmohan Singh ji attend the all-party meeting?" the Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister asked.

402.title: Delhi govt’s power subsidy is 'propaganda': Gautam Gambhir
402.article_body: East Delhi MP Gautam Gambhir said claims of power subsidy by the Delhi government are an eyewash as it comes from taxes paid by the people. "In the past eight years, people of Delhi have just been at the receiving end of propaganda and hogwash," Gambhir said. He added that private electricity companies collect around ₹20,000 crore every year.

403.title: Fire at Rajasthan vegetable market, dozen shops gutted; no casualties
403.article_body: A major fire broke out at a vegetable market in Rajasthan's Dholpur district on Saturday night. Reports said that a dozen shops were gutted in the fire. Several fire tenders reportedly reached the spot. However, the cause of the fire is yet to be ascertained. No casualties were reported in the incident.
